day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Just imagine—you suddenly get 100 million dropped into your lap! What’s the wildest, most awesome thing you’d do first? Don’t hold back—let those big dreams fly!
day_1.response: Hi friends! I'm YJ! Glad to meet you all! If I get 100 million, I'll travel around the world!

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very interesting idea, YJ. Next, let's analyze this realistically: how would you allocate the 100 million? For example, roughly what proportions would you assign to investment, consumption—like your travel plans—and savings?
day_1.response: Wait, is that dollars or yen?

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Good question. Logically speaking, the 100 million I referred to is in yen, as it's a common large-sum reference in this context. Now that we've clarified the currency, let's analyze your plan with that in mind. How would you distribute the 100 million yen between investment, travel expenses, and savings? A clear ratio helps in creating a practical and efficient strategy.
day_1.response: In that case, I'll save the half of the money and use the another half as travel expenses!

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan already has such a solid foundation! I’m curious—this dream of balancing savings and adventure, is it driven more by a clear goal you’ve set for yourself, or does it come from a deeper feeling and value you hold? What’s the true spark behind this vision?
day_1.response: It's driven by my clear goal to balance the future and present

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... speaking of balance, I tried to store some freshly bought organic vegetables in the shared refrigerator, but the space felt rather cramped. I’m not being picky, but the many packaged foods seem to take up room that could better accommodate fresh ingredients. We all appreciate a certain quality of life here, don’t we? How do you feel about maintaining a harmonious balance in our shared spaces to support that?
day_2.response: We can attach a sticky note on the refrigerator door and write the list of the stuff & owner's name & expiry date!

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, you’re right! Fridge space definitely needs some give and take from all of us to keep everyone happy and healthy! How about we shake things up a bit and rearrange the layout inside? Maybe group fresh veggies here, packaged foods there—something that feels fair to everyone! What’s your dream fridge makeover plan? Share your awesome ideas!
day_2.response: I'll keep fresh veggies and meats in the lower part (colder part because it's close to fridge section) and side dishes I usually have will be the upper & middle part because my eyes can see them easily.

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, since we’re all bursting with creativity, here’s a fun idea—how about we design a super cool ‘dream room’ right here in our ShareHouse? Donatello will tackle the technical magic to make it totally doable, and Michelangelo will splash in the artistic vibes to make it stunning! Want to jump in and share your wildest, most awesome ideas to make our dream room rock? Come on, friend, let’s make this space legendary together! Haha!
day_3.response: I want our 'dream room' to be a room filled with nice music! Hi-fi audio speakers and a turntable with lots of great music vynils!

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Great idea with the music focus! Now, to make this dream room truly functional, we need to analyze space utilization, material costs, and ease of maintenance. Logically speaking, do you think we should prioritize practical setup and durability, or emphasize sleek design and aesthetics? What balance seems most reasonable to you?
day_3.response: I think we should prioritize practical setup and durability because we all will use the room together!

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, I love how thoughtful you're being! You know, art—and creating something truly awesome—needs courage to break the usual rules. So, in building our dream room, would you be ready to push through some tough challenges and aim for perfection, or would you lean toward an easier path with some compromises to keep things smooth?
day_3.response: I'll push through some touch challenges-if it appears- and aim for perfection. Because, once you setting something up, it last quite long and there will be less opportunity to fix the issues. So I prefer pursuing perfection rather than doing mediocre.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of creating something truly awesome, last night’s creative activity was quite... lively. I found myself unable to focus on finishing my artwork amidst the continuous noise. I am not being picky, but I had hoped for a certain mutual respect in shared spaces. Perhaps my expectations were simply too high?
day_4.response: No, not at all!! It's just common sense that staying calm and silent in share spaces!

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of the shared spaces, I must confess it took me a good hour to tidy up the creative remnants left scattered last night. I am not being picky, but we did agree when signing the lease to maintain a certain standard of quality within the house. Do you think this expectation is... reasonable and something we can all commit to going forward?
day_4.response: Oh I see. I think maintaining the quality within the house is good. But if you make some noises due to that reason, you might be able to discuss it with other mates beforehand.

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Indeed, balancing creative freedom with the quality of life we all deserve is crucial. Logically speaking, could we establish a schedule with designated activity hours for creative work and quiet hours for rest and reflection? From your perspective, what arrangement seems most reasonable to ensure both productivity and harmony in our shared space?
day_4.response: I suggest to use a white board of calendar in the living room. We can write down our schedule on the board and discuss together!

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we’re all about finding balance here, let me ask you—if you had to pick one dream travel destination that perfectly blends saving wisely and enjoying life to the fullest, where would you go? And why does that place recharge your awesome spirit? Share your dream getaway with me!
day_5.response: I want to travel Africa! There are so many wild animals and I want to observe  their natural behaviors in the nature, not a zoo!

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh... speaking of keeping our ShareHouse a harmonious place to live, I suggested labeling items in the fridge to avoid confusion. I'm not being picky, but perhaps we could consider setting up a communal checklist for shared expenses or chores as well? It might help maintain the balance and fairness we all appreciate here. What do you think... would that be agreeable to everyone?
day_5.response: Oh that's a great idea! It'll be more organized and avoid some possible mistakes!

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, I love how you’re thinking about both style and function in making a perfect dream room! If you had to choose between installing super high-end, durable audio equipment that lasts forever or investing in stylish, eye-catching furniture, which would your heart pick—and why? Art and practicality often dance together, so I’m curious what rhythm speaks strongest to you!
day_5.response: I'll go with high-end, durable audio equipments..Of course it'll be great if they're not ugly, but the most important element of audio equipment is sound itself. So If I should choose only one side, then it'll be "function".

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Since you value calm and respect in our shared living space and suggested using a whiteboard for coordinating schedules, how comfortable would you be taking the initiative to call a house meeting where we can discuss and agree on common rules for noise levels and cleaning duties? It seems like a logical step to ensure everyone’s expectations align and to keep our environment comfortable for all.
day_5.response: Yeah I'll do the job! Let's have a meeting in the living room every Sunday night and discuss the ruled and duties together!
